meanings.definition: The central point, pin, or shaft on which a mechanism turns or oscillates.
meanings.sent1: The door swung open smoothly on its pivot.
meanings.sent2: The pivot of the wheel allowed it to spin freely.
meanings.sent3: The lazy Susan was so wobbly, it couldn't pivot properly.
meanings.sent4: His career seemed stuck until a new opportunity acted as a pivot.
meanings.sent5: The pivot of the seesaw made it easy for the children to play.

meanings.definition: A person or thing on which something depends or turns; the central or crucial factor.
meanings.sent1: She was the pivot of the team, holding everyone together.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project hinged on that one pivot.
meanings.sent3: The missing ingredient was the pivot in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude acted as a pivot in turning the situation around.
meanings.sent5: The pivot of the story revealed the unexpected twist.

meanings.definition: To turn on or as if on a pivot.
meanings.sent1: He had to pivot the chair to face the window.
meanings.sent2: The dancer pivoted gracefully on one foot.
meanings.sent3: She tried to pivot the conversation towards a lighter topic.
meanings.sent4: The company had to pivot its strategy to adapt to the changing market.
meanings.sent5: The basketball player had to pivot quickly to avoid the defender.

meanings.definition: To depend or hinge on something.
meanings.sent1: His decision to invest would pivot on the financial forecast.
meanings.sent2: The success of the event pivoted on her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The entire plan would pivot on whether the weather cooperated.
meanings.sent4: Her mood seemed to pivot on the outcome of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The team's victory would pivot on their ability to work together.
